title: Art in the Moment: Wonder Years
description:
Art in the Moment invites individuals with dementia and their care partners or family members to the Art Institute for creative discussions in the museum galleries and an art-making project in a studio setting. Participants have the opportunity to explore ideas about art and artists during a visit to the museum galleries, experience intellectual stimulation through creative expression, participating in meaningful exchanges in a supportive environment and making connections in a dynamic group setting using personal experiences. This session will focus on Wonder Years: images of children, family, and childhood remembrances.

To register, please contact Theresa Dewey, Alzheimer's Association, Greater Illinois Chapter, at tdewey@alz.org or (847) 779-6963. This program is supported by the Cigna Foundation and is free for all participants, including care partners. Tour begins at 1:00pm and ends at 3:30pm. Learn more about Art in the Moment events.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
